unnormalised: Delhi residents saw a slight bump in their electricity bills this month! BSES reported an avg. increase of 2.5% across all sectors, mainly due to higher fuel costs. Apparently, the price of imported coal went up quite a bit, affecting generation charges. A lot of people I know were grumbling about it over chai yesterday!
normalised: Delhi residents saw a slight bump in their electricity bills this month! B-S-E-S reported an average increase of two point five percent across all sectors, mainly due to higher fuel costs. Apparently, the price of imported coal went up quite a bit, affecting generation charges. A lot of people I know were grumbling about it over chai yesterday!

unnormalised: The water bills also showed some fluctuation. DJB (Delhi Jal Board) said that households consuming >20,000 liters per month are likely to see a 3% rise. The free water scheme remains in place for those below that limit, though. My neighbor, Mrs. Sharma, was really relieved; she told me her bill's usually around Rs. 1500.
normalised: The water bills also showed some fluctuation. D-J-B (Delhi Jal Board) said that households consuming greater than twenty thousand liters per month are likely to see a three percent rise. The free water scheme remains in place for those below that limit, though. My neighbor, Missus Sharma, was really relieved; she told me her bill's usually around rupees one thousand five hundred.

unnormalised: Telecom bills, on the other hand, seem to be holding steady. Airtel and Jio haven't announced any tariff hikes recently. But, be warned - those pesky "value-added services" can still rack up a bill of Rs. 50 or so without you even realizing it! I've heard some people complaining about surprise charges.

unnormalised: Overall, looks like managing our household budget is getting trickier! We all need to be a little more mindful of our usage and keep an eye on those bills! Maybe it's time to switch to LED bulbs and shorter showers? Every little bit helps, right?
